page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO DURSLEY
page.content: Introduction to Block 03720198. {The Landscape}contains open farmland, woodland,much of the ancient town of Dursley and the neighbouring parishes of Cam and Stinchcombe. Dursley is set in the valley of the River Ewelme above which lies the most westerly spur of the Cotswold hills. Several industries have developed in recent times to replace traditional cloth-making mills.Although the town population is 5,000 there are 15,000 people living within 2.5 miles of the centre with Cam forming the main dormitory village. Dursley is referred to in the original Domesday survey.Crossing the block are the M5 motorway,the A38 main trunk route and the railway connecting Gloucester with Bristol.
